snippet: Two papers agree that some people in the Brazilian Amazon are distant relations of indigenous Australians, New Guineans and other Australasians, but they disagree on the source of the ancestry.
abstract: Research papers published in journals Nature and Science agree that some people in Brazilian Amazon are distant relations of indigenous Australians, New Guineans and other Australasians, but they disagree on source of ancestry; one scientific team says two different populations came from Siberia to settle the Americas, while other group says there was only one founding population from which all indigenous Americans descended.
lead_paragraph: Two papers agree that some people in the Brazilian Amazon are distant relations of indigenous Australians, New Guineans and other Australasians, but they disagree on the source of the ancestry.

headline.main: Scientists Trace an Ancient DNA Link Between Amazonians and Australasians
headline.print_headline: Scientists Trace an Ancient Connection Between Amazonians and Australasians
